title: Why does ziggs W have a 26 second cooldown?
body:
{{champion:115}} 's satchel charge (his w), has THE longest cooldown of any champ i play, i don't play every champ. and I'm not an expert on what cooldowns should be, but this seems CRAZY long for a non-ultimate ability.

but i do play ziggs so i do know this

W (satchel charge) is always maxed last
its cooldown is 26/24/22/20/18 seconds based on rank

this is Ziggs ONLY form of escape other than{{summoner:4}}
but it is also his only way to interrupt things
and it is also VERY easy to mess up with,and can be unreliable, you need a LOT of practice with it to get the angle and the distance and the location right every time.
and after his rework designed to take down turrets.

now right off that bat, i think even cutting the cooldown by TEN SECONDS on all ranks, would honestly be POSSIBLE because of how high the cooldown currently is.

other option could including just a flat say 12-16 second flat cooldown at all ranks. 

or another option could be to leave the cooldown as is, but refund HALF of the cooldown if the explosion hits and enemy champion.

a 26 second cooldown is CRAZY long  and even 18 seconds is long and that's the FINAL cooldown.

why is his cooldown so darn long?

replies.body:
because as a longranged poke/siege mage, he already is pretty save by default, having an escape on top of that is quite strong, thus that escape has a massive cd.
No other mage with similar range has an escape.

However, i wish it would get reduced cd if you hit an opponent with it to promote agressive usage.

> However, i wish it would get reduced cd if you hit an opponent with it to promote agressive usage.

This could easily backfire though, satel charge's knockup is powerful defensive ability by itself.

Not more powerfull than the defensive tools of other artilery mages.
The 2 sec snare of lux or the kockback of velcoz are similar effective, and just as those tools, it's not that effective if you get engaged on from multiple angles(which usually is the case with ganks) in contrast to it's use as escape.

Yasuo's Windwall is also at 26/24/22/20/18 and he doesn't get to build ANY CDR most of the time, unlike Ziggs.

_Edit_
Guyz! Hey, guyz!
This guy isn't blindly hating Yasuo, throw more downvotes!

All of Yasuo's base cooldown's are massively low. 

Q scales with AS meaning realistically it would be around 1.3-2 seconds at all ranks
W should be long, it's a stupid fucking ability
E is a very low cooldown
R has an insanely low base cooldown, it's ridiculous how impactful of an ability this is while being on such a short CD. Again, realistically at the mid-late game stages it's at a 30-50 second cooldown.

>All of Yasuo's base cooldown's are massively low. 

That's the point.

It was explicitly stated by Riot, his cooldowns are low and his Q doesn't even scale with CD, to prevent him from itemizing CDR to keep his other cooldowns as long as possible.

But it's fine. There's a lot of champion that also have long cooldowns and that's fine too.
But when you get it on somebody with near to zero lane interactions, that's bad and should be buffed.

Ziggs sucks because his kit is just mish-mash without any kind of synergy.
In addition, his only reliable ability is, sadly, his passive.

Despite this, he's the best base defending champion in the game. Sure, Heimer and VK may be able to hold single lane better, but Ziggs has really powerful R that can be used as waveclear

Ziggs actually sucks because when he's good his kit makes games drag out into next fucking week. Super long range safe waveclear means that he can often be too far away to dive while simultaneously blocking a push.

Any siege mage can do this?
Try sieging even in 4v1 situation against Vel'koz. Unless you have 1500+ gap closer assassin or very good flank, you aren't getting that turret. Minions will die faster than they can reach turret range, you can't try to poke him because he has superior range and damage. You can't try to tank turret because if you do, he just melts you with true damage. 
Xerath and Lux can do the same, less effectively but still.

Again, Ziggs' problem is his non-existent kit synergy.
While Lux can Q->E->R you for most of your HP, VK can WER for all of your HP, even Xerath has very good burst when he's able to land E. Only Ziggs can't, as all of his abilities are somewhat easily avoided.
Only thing that resembles combo is WE, a poor-man's Taliyah

Vel'Koz' waveclear isn't remotely comparable to Ziggs' and Ziggs' range is longer.


Ziggs kit DOES have synergy. All of his spells make it that much harder for anyone to dive him.

* Q means he can farm from an extremely safe distance
* W can either wall out an attacker, self peel, or give himself an escape
* E can either assist his waveclear or also be used to wall out attackers
* R is another extremely long range waveclear spell

The only one that can be argued to have less synergy is his passive, but that's good for damaging towers and giving him a little extra damage to potentially aid in killing something that actually manages to successfully dive him, especially if he gets Lich Bane.

Because he can poke from forever stall out sieges builds a  bunch of CDR and his W destroys towers that are at 35% health. You now have all the answers you need. Also, lowering the CD to where you want it drastically decreases the all in potential on a poke mage. He needs a weakness and if he flubs his w he is fucked. Thats the point. So it takes more skill. Your drop it to 12 seconds suggestion would make him a poking version of Fizz and could allow his team 3 structures in 2 minion waves possibly even 3 if the tower was softened already

I mean, as it stands right now I could see some room to give him minor compensation (he just isn't filling his niche strongly at the moment), but it would probably only be like 3-5 seconds at rank 1 with his rank 5 w cooldown being the same, 12 is way too short yeah.
